article_text:
Syphilis cases in women doubled statewide between 2012 and 2014

Fresno County designated an area with high numbers of syphilis cases

Fresno County women must be screened for syphilis three times during pregnancy

article_metadata.news-keywords: Fresno County, syphilis, Madera County, Merced County, STDs, California Department of Public Health, Dr. Karen Smith, congenital syphilis
article_metadata.description: Too many women in the Central Valley and Los Angeles have syphilis, state health officials said Monday. And of greater concern: Women are passing the infection to their children during pregnancy.
article_metadata.title: Spike in Valley women with syphilis prompts health concern | Fresno Bee
